settings.title: What is the lifespan of my Revolve360™ Slim?
settings.content: The Revolve360™ Slim has a 10-year expiration from the date of manufacture. The specific expiration date for your seat is listed on the date and model label on the product.

settings.title: How long can my child stay rear-facing in the Revolve360™ Slim?
settings.content: The Revolve360™ Slim can be used in rear-facing mode until the child reaches either 50 lb. (22,6 kg), 48 in. (122 cm) or the top of their head is less than 1 in. (2.5 cm) below the top of the headrest or car seat shell, whichever is taller. Once your child reaches any of these three measurements, the child has outgrown the car seat in rear-facing mode.

settings.title: Where is the date and model label?
settings.content: You can find the date of manufacture, model name and model number on a label on the rear of the car seat over the User Guide storage pocket. It is also located on the car seat base near the LockStrong™ belt tensioning arm.

settings.title: How much does the Revolve360™ Slim weigh?
What are the dimensions of the Revolve360™ Slim?
settings.content: The Revolve360™ Slim measures 20.8” d (53.0 cm) x 24.3” h (61.8 cm) x 16.7” w (42.4 cm) when forward-facing in the lowest headrest position. Refer to this chart for additional measurements (all measurements include padding):

settings.title: How many buckle positions are on the Revolve360™ Slim and are there any restrictions based on mode of use?
settings.content: The Revolve360™ Slim offers three buckle positions to help fit your growing child. You can use any of the three positions in either extended rear-facing or forward-facing harnessed mode. You must use the position that places the buckle closest to, but not underneath, your child. Children over 40 lb. (18kg) must use outermost position from the seatback.

settings.title: Does the Revolve360™ Slim come with a seat protector mat?
settings.content: No, but we do have an accessory mat available at www.evenflo.com. You can also place a towel beneath and behind the car seat to help protect your vehicle upholstery.

settings.title: Does the Revolve360™ Slim include a base?
settings.content: Yes, the Revolve360™ Slim consists of a seat shell and base. The seat shell is removable to ensure easy installation.

settings.title: Does the Revolve360™ Slim have an anti-rebound bar?
settings.content: The base of the Revolve360™ Slim acts as an anti-rebound system — a lot like an antirebound bar. This feature absorbs and dissipates crash forces to help provide additional stability.

settings.title: Does the Revolve360™ Slim have a load leg?
settings.content: This car seat exceeds or meets all applicable Federal motor vehicle safety standards and Evenflo’s internal testing standards. The Revolve360™ Slim is not designed with a load leg. The Revolve360™ Slim is engineered to manage crash energy appropriately without the addition of a load leg.

settings.title: Does the Revolve360™ Slim fit into a travel bag?
settings.content: Yes, it fits in the Evenflo Universal Fit Car Seat, Travel Bag & Storage Bag which is sold separately at www.evenflo.com.

settings.title: Does the Revolve360™ Slim include SensorSafe™?
settings.content: The Revolve360™ Slim Gold models come equipped with integrated SensorSafe™ technology which can be found on www.amazon.com or www.evenflo.com.

settings.title: How long can I use the Revolve360™ Slim’s additional insert under the body pillow?
settings.content: The Revolve360™ Slim comes with a few soft goods components to help improve your child’s comfort and fit. 1) The optional infant insert can be used at any time in rearfacing mode but must be removed in forward-facing mode. 2) The optional seat protector pad, for use in extended rear-facing mode, is designed to simplify clean-up in your car seat without the need to remove the entire cover. When using in forward-facing mode, the optional seat protector pad must be removed once your child weighs more than 40 lbs.

settings.title: How easy is it to install the Revolve360™ Slim?
settings.content: Installing the Revolve360™ Slim is easy with the Sure360TM Safety Installation System, which includes the LockStrong™ belt tensioning system to help you get a tight installation with either the lower anchors (LATCH/UAS) or seat belt, and the Tether360™ which is used in both rear-facing and forward-facing harness installations.

settings.title: What is LockStrong™?
settings.content: LockStrong™ is a belt tensioning system that helps you easily achieve a tight installation with either the lower anchors (LATCH/UAS) or vehicle seat belt. It is built into the base and applies additional tension, so you get a maximum result with minimal effort. IMPORTANT: Your vehicle seat belt MUST be locked to ensure accurate and safe installation. Check your vehicle owner’s manual for instruction on how to lock your vehicle seat belt for car seat use.

settings.title: What is the easiest way to install the Revolve360™ Slim?
settings.content: #The seat belt is the preferred method of installation for the Revolve360™ Slim because it allows you to take advantage of a true, one-time installation. Always use the tether in both rear-facing and forward-facing harness installations, regardless of whether you have the car seat base installed with the seat belt or lower anchors (LATCH/UAS).

settings.title: What is the best way to install the Revolve360™ Slim if I plan to move it between cars?
settings.content: The seat belt is the preferred method of installation for the Revolve360™ Slim because it allows you to take advantage of a true, one-time installation. Always use the tether in both rear-facing and forward-facing harness installations, regardless of whether you have the car seat base installed with the seat belt or lower anchors (LATCH/UAS).

settings.title: What does ‘one-time install’ mean?
settings.content: When using the vehicle belt for installation, the car seat does not have to be reinstalled when switching between rear-facing and forward-facing harness modes
